body: LGTM. Merged to trunk.
Unit test failures are relevant. cc @mjsax
If rocksdb#2533 is indeed an overlook by the rocksDB community which means we cannot work with 5.4.5 anyways, then I'm good with 5.3.6; let's wait for a bit more on that ticket.
@guozhangwang can you take a look at this really trivial PR. It's just a simple error in the not updated doc after some code change. Thanks !
Environmental issues in last brach builder run. Re-triggered as https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/956/
retest this please

@enothereska, thanks for the explanation. I definitely agree that avoiding `throws Exception` in non-test code is important.

It's just for test code that I think enumerating exceptions doesn't add much. If there's a single exception, then no harm in using the more specific type.

I had a closer look at the PR and most of it is removing unnecessary declarations and that is definitely worthwhile, so I agree that we should try to merge this. I'll leave it to @dguy to decide if he is OK with merging as is or if he would prefer some changes first.

And thanks for your contribution @evis!
@dguy are you ok if we keep the cleanup but whenever we have more than one specific exception we just throw `Exception`.

Hi @granthenke, @viktorsomogyi, @peter-toth,
Can I ask you to review this change?

@pradeepcheers There is no functional difference. We added a version to Kafka itself so it would be available across all connectors -- we saw a number of connectors including their own, so it made sense to include it out of the box since it's really simple anyway and should have no real maintenance cost.

Compare: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3439#discussion_r125845931

\cc @ijuma @guozhangwang @dguy @enothereska @bbejeck 

Needs to go into `trunk`, `0.11.0` and `0.10.2`. Thx.

```
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/5918/testReport/junit/org.apache.kafka.streams.integration/QueryableStateIntegrationTest/shouldAllowToQueryAfterThreadDied/
```
Also could you point me to the JIRA ticket tracking this flaky test? Do we know / have any theory about its flakiness?
And also is it related to this commit? https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/0046a881d389878bbb673c2591c06fd667923964, if yes do we still need this?

It's not related to https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/0046a881d389878bbb673c2591c06fd667923964 that is about unit tests (not system tests)
